article.headline: Bucknell 76, Lafayette 58
article.story: LEWISBURG, Pa. (AP) -- Chris McNaughton had a season-high 21 points to lead Bucknell to its ninth consecutive win, 76-58 over Lafayette on Thursday night. John Griffin added 16 and Abe Badmus had 13 for the Bison (17-8, 11-1 Patriot League), who have won 33 consecutive home conference games and the last eight meetings in the series. The Bison remain tied for first place with Holy Cross. Lafayette (8-18, 2-9), which led for just 48 seconds in the game's opening moments, has lost its last five in a row. Matt Betley had 13 points and six rebounds to lead Lafayette. Darren Mastropaolo had eight points and career highs with 11 rebounds and five assists for Bucknell. McNaughton had 12 of his points as the Bison raced to a 41-21 halftime lead. They shot 53.6 percent from the field. The Leopards made just six of 24 shots and had 12 turnovers in the first 20 minutes. Neither team missed a free throw in the first half, making a combined 14 for 14. The Bison clinched at least the second seed and home games through the league tournament semifinals with the victory. The game was delayed 20 minutes because Lafayette had travel problems on Interstate 80 due to the previous day's snowstorm. Bucknell, which has won 17 of its last 21 games since an 0-4 start, hosts Towson on Saturday.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
